meanings.definition: A type of whale known for its large dorsal fin.
meanings.sent1: I saw a group of finbacks swimming gracefully in the ocean.
meanings.sent2: The finbacks surfaced to breathe before diving back into the deep sea.
meanings.sent3: The finbacks decided to have a race to see who could reach the finish line first.
meanings.sent4: The majestic finbacks cut through the water like sleek submarines.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the finbacks gliding through the waves left a lasting impression on me.

meanings.definition: The plural form of 'finback', referring to multiple whales of this species.
meanings.sent1: We were lucky to spot a pod of finbacks during our whale watching tour.
meanings.sent2: The researchers observed the finbacks feeding together in a synchronized manner.
meanings.sent3: The finbacks held a meeting to discuss their migration plans for the season.
meanings.sent4: The vast ocean echoed with the calls of the finbacks as they communicated with each other.
meanings.sent5: The playful antics of the finbacks entertained the onlookers on the boat.
